website_summaries.verdict: A rugged, waterproof dry bag with a large capacity that's easy to carry with you on any adventure.
pros: Floats on water for easy retrieval
Watertight bag that can stand up to a lot of use
cons: There have been a few complaints about the straps breaking

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after just a few months
customer_reviews.text: Bag seems to work fine in the waterproof department, but after less than 5 months the attachment for the strap on the side of the bag pulled off and now I cannot use the strap. I emailed the company about this and have not received a response. I like the product but I am a bit annoyed that it was not as durable as I expected. I would love to hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Walter McGovern Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Dry Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! Used while snorkeling and jet skiing. Everything stayed dry. I highly recommend this dry bag! You can see the bag behind my head in the pic.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tarte

customer_reviews.title: Many uses.
customer_reviews.text: Before we even got this packed for our boat trip, my daughter found it most entertaining. Made me smile! 10ml is the Perfect size to carry phones, camera and personal items on the boat while we go scuba diving.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to get in and out of as needed
customer_reviews.text: Handy for tubing! Kept this 20L bag clipped to the tube while strolling down the river. Was easy to get in and out of as needed. Avoid keeping damp items inside on hot days as condensation may form on the interior. Definitely great to have!
customer_reviews.author: Brian H!

customer_reviews.title: The dry bag is NOT submersible!
customer_reviews.text: The dry bag is NOT submersible!. Tested it in swimming pool. water gets in. The cell phone bag is NOT water proof. Tested in in bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this dry bag at all
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this dry bag at all. My canoe tipped over in the Current River in Missouri a few times this weekend, so this dry bag ended up in the water. I expected everything inside it to be dry, especially since I rolled it closed at least 4 or 5 times and had the snaps buckled. My clothes inside were all very wet. It did not keep anything dry inside it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R. from Willard, MO

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Work!
customer_reviews.text: This bag did not work at all! I tested it out while it was raining by putting a roll of paper towels inside and rolling the rope 4-5 times to seal the bag. When I opened it back up, the paper towel roll was completely soaked! I’m not talking a few sheets or half the roll, the entire roll was soaked and dripping wet everywhere. There was no protection whatever inside that bag! I was hoping to use this in Niagara Falls, but if it can’t handle a little rain, there’s no way this would work at the Falls. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy H.

customer_reviews.title: PICTURE IS NOT ACCURATE. Handles not removable on 30L
customer_reviews.text: THE 30L size is a backpack!!!! The handles are not removable. I just took a peak and bad sewing to, but the picture clearly show a removable handle. need this to go inside a large pack for canoe tripping extra handles just get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M-E

customer_reviews.title: Seems fray , strap is weak,no confidence
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is great, no conplaints. The clip on the strap broke the first day. Not the biggest of deals but I am dissatisfied. If it has problems I'll comment again. Update: After a couple weekends of use I noticed the seems started fraying at the bottom. I've lost confidence in this product. Do not reccomend. Update: Received the replacement after a few trips im seeing fraying at the seems again. The bag is only sitting on my paddle board and then going in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Cell A.

customer_reviews.title: Ruined 3 phones!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was unsure about the way the bag sealed but became comfortable with it. I have used it about 5 times total over the last year. It worked fine until the last trip. I was storing 3 phones and some clothes inside this bag. Water somehow got in and now the phones are all damaged. 2 will not even power on and the other's camera doesn't work. I am very bummed that this waterproof bag did not keep water from our phones. I would say only trust this with clothing or towels that are nice to have dry but won't cost you hundreds of dollars if the bag fails.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia G.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, keeps content dry! Would buy again .
customer_reviews.text: --Pros & Cons by Acid-- Pros::. This thing is awesome lol. I was skeptical of how well it would work, so took it to the lake and packed my expensive camera, phones, everything into it and went on the boat. A few times I pulled a few things out of the bag and each time I sorta used it as a floating device. It holds air tightly and keeps water out perfectly. This is great even for a festival backpack as it only has one opening so it's nice and secure. Cons::. None! Overall::. Great backpack. It unfolds super tall but when you do 4-5 rolls it makes it small and good looking. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Edited (Not Happy) Product is thick and durable.
customer_reviews.text: ***** Edit ***** I used it for 2 weeks and it was waterproof, and I was happy. What I wasn't happy about is that threads/fiber strands on the bottom of the bag was already ripping out. See picture for reference ************************* Material is really good. Thick and durable, the stitching looks solid. I tried it by keeping air inside and tried to squeeze it out and it seems to work, did not deflate so there were no leaks. I haven't had the chance to test it out yet if it'll keep whatever's inside the bag dry but will update soon.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this recently before going on vacation, and so glad I did. I got the 20L in a blue color. Very happy with it so far. Its lightweight, and looks loke it will last a while. Haven't gotten a chance to get it really wet to test it out, but I doubt anything will happen to the contents if its closed correctly. They also sent me a waterproof phone case, which unfortunately was damaged, but they were happy to replace it right away. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Offroad approved.
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these for my rock buggy, RZR and other offroad toys. The 30 works best in terms of size for my needs. Perfect for storing coats, first aid and other essential things while out on long trips in the woods. Keeps ticks, mosquitoes and other critters out and of course rain. Very nice having a dry coat to put on while everything else is soaked inside. Reasonable price point. I question durability as it scuffed pretty easy just riding in one of my vehicles, time will tell. Overall, I feel it was a good buy and have since ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: 4rnr

customer_reviews.title: Love Earth Pak Color
customer_reviews.text: The Earth Pak arrived on time. I love the bright color!! I tested the Pak by putting a towel inside, folding the top over 4 times, and closing the latch. Since we have had rain for days, I left the Earth Pak outside for 24 hours. When I opened it the next day, the towel was damp in several places and the inside of the bag was also damp. I wouldn't call this Pak waterproof but I believe it will provide good protection when I go white water rafting in a few weeks. I believe it will provide great "splash" protection but I wouldn't go swimming in water with it.
customer_reviews.author: MDShopper

customer_reviews.title: lunch and pretty much what ever else you will need
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely well made. Very solid and large enough to hold a coat plus small items (10L) or in the 20L a coat, lunch and pretty much what ever else you will need. I got the yellow, so that if it goes overboard somehow, I can easily spot it. It will fit well into my kayak, and I can use the shoulder strap clip to clip it to a ring on the kayak. Well worth the money. In fact, I am glad I bought it before the popularity and therefore the price goes up!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Would rate it 0 out of 5 (not even 1)
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally very supportive and appreciative of third party sellers on Amazon but this was utterly disappointing. I just received it, unboxed it and tried to put the neck lanyard (for the phone/electronics bag) around my neck - IT SNAPPED! No pulling, no yanking - just the friction that it takes to put it around the head was enough to snap it. I'm assuming it's a manufacturing defect and uncharacteristic - but I'm glad it snapped now instead of in the middle of the river/beach somewhere. What good is a waterproof case if the case itself detaches and flows away with my phone in it?! Concerned about whether I should even take a chance with the dry bag itself...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Linetsky

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT Dry Bag for my Beach needs!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I was looking for... We recently moved to the beach and I'm in the water nearly every day. Needed something to keep my belongings dry. This is the perfect size for a couple of hand towels, a bottle of sunscreen, a nylon beach blanket, my keys, small purse, and phone. Keeps everything bone dry. Keeps everything bone dry.... even as it is pounded by waves or submerged in the salty water as it hangs from my sand chair as the tide comes in upon me. A GREAT PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Fischer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good looking bag
customer_reviews.text: We used this dry bag on a trip to French Polynesia. Brought it everywhere-on a boat (standing on outside observation deck in tropical rain), a jet ski tour, a shark excursion, and lunch IN the water. Our stuff stayed totally dry. It's a good looking bag, people asked where we got it. 10LB green bag, perfect size. Used waterproof phone case too, did not submerge it, no issues. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great bear bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Earth Pak mainly for use as a bear bag to hang my food in during a backpacking trip. I ended up using it for that purpose and more. After setting camp, i used the provided shoulder strap to turn this into a day bag, as well as to house my camera gear and cell phone when it started to rain during the hike out. The Earth Pak served my needs well, and i wouldnt hesistate to purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Zach M

customer_reviews.title: User Error You Say...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful blue and excited to use along with the tremendous reviews. Survived the bathtub test. Sadly, the real life need that mattered, did not. I rolled it flush with an air pocket 4x and buckled it (passed seeing the black trim by far). Hugged it, felt sturdy and held it's puff. By end of the rafting trip, the bag deflated and took on half a bag full of water. HOW?? Luckily I bought a different phone waterproof bag (RANVOO, the best) and it saved the phone in the bag. EVERYTHING ELSE...soaked and ruined. I could have left things in my pants pocket and it would have been more dry. Get it out of my sight.
customer_reviews.author: DHW

customer_reviews.title: What is this?
customer_reviews.text: What in the world is this? The newer bags with the zipper pocket have none of this stitching coming loose nor do they feel thinner like the original. I own two of the new zipper pocket dry bags and they are very nice but the original so far has been disappointing just on initial appearance. I cannot trust this bag to keep my items dry if the stitching appears to come off on the bottom. The company sells good bags but look to the future and get their newer products not the original at least not in white. I am requesting a return on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great Products!
customer_reviews.text: Great Products!!. Earth Pak's Dry bag is a perfect fit for the inside of my small backpack to keep my electronics and 'dry stuff' dry and safe. And the phone case is awesome! it has kept my phone dry during rafting, kayaking, and swimming. I'm also able to take video and pictures through the case with no image distortion through the case. My wife has a 'want-to-be' phone case that pales in comparison to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Maci C.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, affordable and it just works!
customer_reviews.text: I tested this out by taking it on a lazy river and it held up nicely. It kept my clothes and accessories dry. The material looks very sturdy so I have didn’t fear that a random sharp rock will puncture it. My next test will be taking it white water rafting, so there will be more opportunities for rougher waters to cause water to seep in, but at this point I’m not worried and I’m sure that it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product for it's price. I took it to the beach and just swam with it and it EVERYTHING completely dry inside! I also used it for the snow, and it works completely fine. Definitely would recommend this for anyone who's always out getting wet either intentionally or accidentally. The phone holder case is also a huge life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: A great bag at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a gear bag for a big kayak trip and I took a chance on this. I fit my sleeping bag and clothes bag with room to spare. All my other gear was stored "below deck" so I needed to make sure what was stored lashed to the deck of my kayak remained dry. It did! I was very pleased with this bag. It sealed well. The back pack style straps were comfortable and seemed sturdy. I didn't pack-carry any great distance but they seemed like they would last. I was very pleased and if I'm looking for any other similar type of bag, I will check this vendor first.
customer_reviews.author: K. Whittemore

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dry bag specifically to house my nebulizer and supplies for protection. When I returned to my hotel room I placed the bag with the above contents inside under the running shower (no more than 15-30 seconds) to rinse off the salt water from the catamaran excursion I was on. I dried the outside of the bag and opened it to find the supplies used for the nebulizer machine was wet. The bag was rolled 5 times. Thankfully, the machine was at the bottom wrapped in a towel. VERY UPSET. This brand is listed as #1. I will be shopping for another bag. Thank you Angelique
customer_reviews.author: angelique l.

customer_reviews.title: great bag for emergency prep
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to put it to use test yet ---but it seems very durable and of good quality!--great bag for emergency prep--put one your vehicle or have one ready--I like the fabric heavier vinyl rip type ---I think will sustain much while your rough-in it and I purchased the 40 L size --big enough to hold my solar panel- and emergency kit--a small blanket-clothing change, and some food,and a little burner and water filter--plus you get a cover for you phone---the bag also comes nicely packed in a durable plastic bag, which I used to pack emergency first aid /brochures etc info one might need---I consider this to be a great cost effective purchase--and I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: pattio

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this dry bag. I use it for kayaking and it's perfect. Just a giant bucket bag with so many uses. Only thing I'd say is it's definitely not a hiking bag by any means. It only has one strap so just a quick hull from car to boat or camp site not a long journey as the strap isn't very comfortable if you have heavy things inside. All in all I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mottola

customer_reviews.title: Bag of Choice for Rainy Camping Trip
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag. My 7th grade daughter went on a 3 day hiking/rafting school trip. It rained quite a bit and I was worried about her gear staying dry. I packed all her regular clothes (not coats/sweatshirts) in this bag. It worked perfectly. It easily fit well rolled kid size shirts, pants, underwear and sox for 3 days. She did not use it while rafting, but I believe this bag would even succeed in that situation. I would recommend this to anyone who camps or hikes.
customer_reviews.author: SLV444

customer_reviews.title: Solid Quality and Functionality for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 20L and 2 10L dry bags for camping. A single 20L bag is great for all my clothes for 2-4 day trip and still fits well within my frame packs. The 10L bag is great for the various smaller items that need protection and fits well within my day packs. The 10L bag also worked well for holding all my kid's clothing for a 2-3 day camping trip and still fit within his day pack. The build quality appears solid and the removal strap is great for when you are just putting it into your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and good attention to waterproof seam security
customer_reviews.text: Have not tested it by submerging in water but based on the material and attention to detail I'm pretty sure it will perform well when I use it for camera gear in my kayak. The bonus dry case for cell phones is also a nice touch and seems quite useful - easy to see through and clear enough that you should be able to get reasonable pictures but detailed interaction with the phone through the dry case could be a challenge. Overall, good quality and reasonably priced. I expect to get a lot of use out of both items.
customer_reviews.author: ddev

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I used this while hiking through a rainforest with my expensive camera in tow. Each time I was worried about it getting wet I'd toss it in this bag. The inside of the bag and my camera never got wet. My only complaint is the single strap, which would cause the bag to whip around when scaling rocks/uneven surfaces. I know the 30L bag has this option, but that's too large for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product! Does all it says it will
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product just a couple days before leaving for a trip to Hawaii knowing I'd be hiking in the rain and spending time on sandy beaches. This bag handled all situations, and it ended up being to only bag I used the whole trip. Comfortable to hike with, kept the water out at the beach. Only downside is that it is a little annoying to unroll/re-roll every time you need something, especially in the sand, so try to grab anything you need at once. But that's the nature of the product and how it works so well so I can't fault it for that! The waterproof phone pouch was an extra bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Goss

customer_reviews.title: River Bag Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is super easy to use and very effective at keeping everything inside bone dry! It is much better than you would expect at accommodating all your gear (we had two towels, clothes for two, sunscreen, phones, keys, snacks and still had room for more!). Fore thought coming into play I would have picked a more visible color, this bag does blend in well. All in all it was an A+ purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Marines

customer_reviews.title: This is how much I love the earth pack dry bag
customer_reviews.text: This is how much I love the earth pack dry bag. I own the 40 l,30l and 10 l. I originally bought the 40 l for a friend and they love it. The color is perfect, the back pack straps are comfortable, have tried this in mild/moderate rain. None of my belongings on inside bag were wet. When you open box your bag will folded into another plastic bag. I actually kept for another dry storage. See pix below for better understanding. Decent price for any size of these bags.
customer_reviews.author: J Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bag For Tubing
customer_reviews.text: This bag is AWESOME!!! I needed something to keep our keys, cigarettes and other stuff dry while tubing on the river. This was perfect. Nothing go wet and the bag was in the water more than once and it also rained. The phone case is just as great. I did the paper towel test overnight before using it. No water got through. Four hours on the river and my phone was completely dry at the end of the trip. My phone was submerged a lot of the time too. One of the best purchases Ive bought so far for our tubing adventures!
customer_reviews.author: TammyC117

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday unfortunately in June so now I can’t get my money back...he took it on our canoe to the springs and put his work phone and personal phone in it only for the entire bag to be soaked after tipping and ruining both phones completely. I can’t tell you how frustrated he was. Definitely was not the trip he imagined that day. I’m not sure how this product has so many stars but now I see several people have had the same thing happen. Really sucks. Don’t buy this product if you’re looking for waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: KimM

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Exactly what I was looking for. Bought it for boat use after we were caught in the rain and my towels got wet. This is perfect. I bought the 40L in white and there is plenty of room: so far I used it for a pool trip but fit 3 sets of clothes for kids, 3 Turkish towels, 3 16oz water bottles, 2 quart size bags with items, sunscreen spray and it’s only 3/4 full. I usually also take snacks, a mexican blanket, and sweaters on the boat and will defn fit that too. Well made and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Durable waterproof bag holds up to heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: I took this dry bag on a 4 day camping & raft trip down the Rogue River in Oregon. I used it as a day bag with sunglasses, sunscreen, a few jackets, etc in it. What was especially helpful is the shoulder strap and connector loop, that could be attached to the raft. We took on lots of waves as we went through the Rapids. There were absolutely no leaks. On returning home, I was able to turn it inside out and wash by hand to get all the sand out. The bag looks brand new after all that use.
customer_reviews.author: MAJ214

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Works OK, but definitely not completely waterproof. I would say water resistant. I place paper towels inside, closed it as the instructions say, and laid it in water for about an hour. (I got this for keeping food dry while tubing, so figured it would be laying in the water a lot for that.) When I took the paper towels out, they were wet, but there was not extra water in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lc

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for hiking the Zion Narrows and I'm so glad I invested. I was able to pack a towel, change of clothes, snacks, and a small baggie of credit cards, chapstick, etc. I also really appreciated the phone case that came with it - used it the whole time around my neck and was able to take photos without fear of my phone falling in the river. The bag feels super high quality and kept everything dry, although it never got fully submerged. It was nice not to worry about the bottom third getting wet at all, and because it floats on the water, helped take the load off my shoulders, which was nice for a 7-mile hike.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and fairly priced.
customer_reviews.text: Great durable bag. I would disregard any reviews of leaky bags who state they held the bag under water. Its a silly and unrealistic test. when would you ever have your bag submerged in 3ft+ of water for more than a few seconds. Trapping some air in the bag when closing it should help to make the bag float quite nicely until you can retrieve it, depending on the weight of its contents. I took this bag on a 16mile kayak trip where it sat in 2in of water for about 6 hrs and was splashed quite a bit. It kept my camera gear dry as a bone and I was never the least bit concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Sam b

customer_reviews.title: Great Dry Bag for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This product shipped very quickly and arrived as advertised. I recently took it on a dive trip and was very happy with the dry bag. I used it to store wallet, phone, beach towel and t-shirt on the boat. The bag was the perfect size to hold all of my items and kept everything 100% dry. I don't know what else you could ask for from a dry bag. The seller followed up diligently to ensure my satisfaction. I recommend this dry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Got the orange one. Not worried about the looks worried about it being spotted if lost or helping if I'm at sea. (Still looks good though for a orange backpack.) It's a Great deal! Took it out on a overnighter kayaking trip to an island. It arrived the day I left didn't so didn't have time to inspect bag or phone case. It was just make or break. Everything came through perfectly. Phone case was just as helpful. Plenty of room in 30lb backpack bag. Will be ordering others again and recommending to other water travelers for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great, waterproof bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. It's really easy to get into and seal up. I've taken it to the river a bunch of times and it's been submerged and everything stayed dry. The material is really heavy duty as well, so I don't worry about it getting damaged on rocks. The fact that it came with a cell phone sleeve was a huge plus and made me originally pick this bag. So I ended up buying 2 since they are so affordable. Will probably end up buying a few more for other members of the family.
customer_reviews.author: Santa8T

customer_reviews.title: It kept all her clothing nice and dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my daughter. She went on a hiking trip with school. This bag was a hit. It kept all her clothing nice and dry. I think the waterproof case for the phone was a great add on to the bag. I loved how this bag can be rolled down and compact. I give this bag a 5star for its quality. I will be using this bag for the beach for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: allison stark

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT waterproof beach bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we needed a bag to bring to the rocky shoreline to keep an eye while we swim. This bag fits the bill perfectly. Very sturdy, bright color and well-constructed, along with plenty of room this bag literally checks all the boxes. While the bag did not end up in the water, we were confident all of our stuff inside would be safe it had. We will certainly purchase again, especially when we need smaller-sized waterproof bags. This bag is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: D Nam

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, well made, does what its advertised to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 55L bag after reading about how large it was, because I was hoping to fit my photography backpack inside it for kayak trips. Its not quite that large. It would fit, but the opening in the top of the back is a little to restrictive to let it past. But this bag will fit everything else you need to put in it; sleeping bags, towels, clothing...no problem. This bag is very well made, heavy duty, rubberized material and should hold up great for repeated uses in the kayak. When rolled up tight and squeezed, it doesnt let any air out, or if so, its to slow to be noticeable, so it should be very waterproof. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: SeanMc

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My Earthpak is wonderful. I bought the 20 Liter size, and i was able to fit two towels, a change of clothing, my purse and some water bottles. Everything stayed nice and dry my entire excursion. I even had the bag partially submerged at times. The bag is easy to fill and easy to close. It even came with a waterproof phone bag too. My only critique is that the bag is only one large pouch with no divided sections. I would like to have some smaller sections for things like keys, medicine containers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great size bag for canoe and nice phone bag bonus.
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag, along with other dry bags on an overnight canoe trip with friends. This bag is a great size for clothes and essentials that you may need quick access to during the trip. The bag has a nice vertical size to rest in the canoe so no need to reorientate for access. It’s a really nice bonus to have the included phone bag which, even if your phone is waterproof gives a nice lanyard for safetying so you don’t drop it in the drink!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Helder

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the kayaks
customer_reviews.text: Earth Pak works great. I've used it when kayaking and on the beach and it has prevented both sand and water from entering the bag. It is important to follow instructions and fold the bag multiple times to ensure water cannot enter the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's yellow
customer_reviews.text: I want so badly to write a 5 star review on this wonderful dry bag,, I really do. But..my story is, right after this bag arrived in the mail I had knee surgery so I've not been anywhere near my kayak or water. The Earth Pac people seem particularly anxious about getting a review so I'm giving one. At this time all I can honestly say is that it arrived in time and it's very yellow. As soon as I'm allowed to paddle I'll add more to this story.
customer_reviews.author: Jules of the Knight

customer_reviews.title: Fuzzies on the seams. Phone pouch broke
customer_reviews.text: Love this waterproof bag! Seems very waterproof and surprisingly fits quite a bit in it! Perfect for floating on the river. Only thing is some parts of it where the seams are started getting little fuzzies on it after the first use. Makes me worry that it won’t hold up over time but we will see. Also the little phone case completely broke while we were on the river and my husband almost lost his phone so DO NOT use it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shaylee

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Durable waterproof. The camera case that came with it works very well. I was able to take Great pictures through it. It allowed me to easily use the touch screen. I had trouble pushing the side button to get the phone screen visible, but other than that it worked very well. It was large enough for my Samsung Note 9 with a case on it. The lanyard that comes with it is Very short. It is too short to just wear around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: GrlizzlyBonster

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I got the 20L size and it's very nice and compact. I use it on my kayak as a tackle bag along with it holding my keys and wallet and it fits 4 medium size tackle boxes if anyone was wondering. My one concern is when you roll it up, the air I side the bag puffs up but deflates after awhile. I don't know how water proof that makes this bag but I do not plan on submerging this bag for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: A++++
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for the delay in review, all! I bought this bag to use in the Dominican Republic for all sorts of water sport activities. As the seller stated, this bag is an A+ bag. I was able to snap the bag around the railing of the yacht and bring it into the surf and all of my personal items remained dry. I will definitely be purchasing the 20L bag next!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag
customer_reviews.text: So good produce and well made. It protect my stuff when i'm in the middle of the sea on the boat and when kayaking. It made with really heavy thick material also the shoulder strap is comfortable. Now i can feel confident with my stuff when i go with water and of course recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulrhman Hasanain

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome, and bigger than I expected. It is 10L and has a nice shoulder strap to wear as back pack. The cell phone carrier was big enough for my iPhone 8 plus and the case it was already in. The phone case also has a strap so you can wear it around your neck while kayaking. I am able to use my touch screen through the plastic case as well so no need to pull it in and out of the water tight case to take pictures while on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley L

customer_reviews.title: Great little dry bag!
customer_reviews.text: First dry pack I've ever owned and this little guy (10L) did a great job keeping spare clothes and snack foods dry and clean for our week long trip to Colorado. This sucker got rained on, hailed on and splashed with mud several times during the trip and help up perfectly! When we got back home we decided to order a bigger one so we can use this one for food and the bigger one for clothes. I was actually surprised that when I roll it up to close it, it seal's so well that the air inside the bag can't escape.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Caribbean trip and it worked GREAT!!! I had my expensive Nikon camera with me but did not want to leave it on the beach unattended so i put it in a plastic bag for GP and put it in the dry bag- everything in the dry bag stayed dry!!! There was not a single drop of water inside of the bag at all!!! It was very durable and I love it and look forward to more adventures with it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kayak/backpacking/camping trip out to Grand Island, MI. Had to pack my gear into something waterproof in order to paddle out to the island. This bag had enough room for the gear I brought for my two night excursion. The straps were comfortable enough for the 4.5mi hike that occurred after the paddle. Glad I bought the big size as it gave me enough room. Hung easily on the bear pole and none showed up so that was a plus. Excited to get many more uses out of this pack.
customer_reviews.author: K. Heuvelman

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful for attaching to my tube
customer_reviews.text: We went floating in a river (my first time) and someone told me I should get one of these types of bags. It floated next to the tube and it kept everything pretty dry. There was a little condensation on the inside but other than that, it was awesome. The phone case it also comes with is super useful. EDIT: Lost my strap when I used this bag in Cancun. FYI It was awesome for holding our phones, change of clothes and towels). I contacted them about getting a replacement strap. I thought I could buy one, but they're sending me one for FREE! The customer service is why I'm changing it from 4 stars to 5.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary N

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Excellent waterproof bag for kayaking and water sports. I was out on the water for 5+ hours without any incidents. The only wet stuff I got was that which I exposed through removal from the bag for use. Its size is appropriate for carrying essentials such as electronics, maps, snacks, knives, etc. I would suggest a separate one for towels and spare clothes.
customer_reviews.author: DragonsLair143

customer_reviews.title: Great for wading
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag for duck hunting. great bag, keeps everything dry. the 20l is a perfect size I was able to put a spare shirt, shorts, boxers, gloves, thermacell, bug spray, hat, and knife, glasses and still had plenty of room. it comes with a waterproof case which is also great. the sling is great for the size of the bag. sling is easy adjustable. I really like the bag it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Coletti

customer_reviews.title: Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Great company to buy from. Super kind customer service. That's where a great company separates itself from a good one. Love my dry bag! The backpack straps make it super convenient for canoe and kayak trips if you are portaging. Also great for a day on the lake or river. Exactly what I was looking for. The material is a heavy rubbery plastic. The craftsmanship appears to be top notch and has held up quite well so far. If you need a dry bag, this is definitely the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Everything dry during a week long canoe trip!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these bags for a trip to the Boundary Waters. It rained on us three nights and our bags were continually wet on the bottom of the canoes, but we were able to rest comfortably knowing our gear was dry and safe. The only suggestion I would offer a potential buyer is to consider the clear bag over the solid colors to make finding specific things easier. Regardless, great bag and very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: VERY COOL BAG
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because we frequently go to the river and beaches so we need a dry bag for phones, towels, etc. This is really easy to use and holds a lot of stuff. We put 4 large beach towels inside along with 3 phones, water bottles and snacks and this bag still had plenty of room to hold more stuff. Its super easy to close and looks great being worn as a backpack. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Girl

customer_reviews.title: Simple but genius
customer_reviews.text: Product is better than advertised. Very happy. We ordered 2-55, 1-40, 2-10 all came in perfect condition. These are the ultimate bug out bags. They hold plenty and stand sturdy when packed correctly. I noticed some reviews complained about the seams. All 5 of our bags are solid and the seam is strong. These bags would also be great for protecting your valuables in storms or earthquake zones.
customer_reviews.author: charli charli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 10L; recently purchased a paddleboard and wanted a water tight bag. Great for your personal items; I’ve been using it for a towel, water bottles, spare clothes, keys, phone and sunscreen. I could easily fit another towel. Keeps the water out very well, seems durable, but I’ve only used it a few times so far. Hope it holds up - in any case, a very low price!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Naples

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised. Great build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Took this island hopping in Thailand, and it was absolutely worth the purchase. If you happen to be in that same part of the world...DONT buy the cheaper versions that are sold by the locals. It only takes one tear in the material to ruin all your stuff. The build quality of this bag was obvious before and during our use of it, and I never had to worry about my dry items being compromised. It's a simple and effective design and it will keep your stuff dry!
customer_reviews.author: sloanrx

customer_reviews.title: Just used my dry bag on a kayak tour
customer_reviews.text: I just used my dry bag on a Mono Lake kayak tour. It did exactly what it is supposed to do. Things got wet in our kayak, but NOTHING in the dry bag got wet. I particularly like the phone case that comes with the dry bag. Great idea and several people noticed it hanging around my neck and asked where I got it. And just in case you are wondering, my phone stayed dry too. Thank you and I will continue to use these items on upcoming kayak trips.
customer_reviews.author: lizbeth

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it. Lol
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great product, I hate rating low but I stuffed some dry towels in here and left them in a bathtub for 6-7 hours and when I opened the bag there were some moisture in it. Maybe condensation? Maybe a towel was damp? A small drip leak somewhere? Many factors but I just can pull myself to commit my camera equipment into it for now... I’m returning it but will eventually give it another try. Have a huge fishing trip planned this weekend with rain everyday in the forecast so I’m pretty bummed! I’ll stick to my bulky pelican case for now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Kept my stuff dry!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Earth Pak bag purchase. My first Earth Pak was a 10L, for a surf trip. Filled it up half way full, in the bath tub - check, no leaks. Kept my electronics and change of clothes dry on the surf trip as we needed to take a boat ride out to the break. The bag performed well keeping things dry for day trips. You can't pack a lot in a 10L. I had confidence to purchase a second bag for a friend who needs a Go Bag for emergencies and purchased the 20L. As the picture shows, the bag comes with a water protectant smart phone case.
customer_reviews.author: mjhl

customer_reviews.title: Best dry bag ever!
customer_reviews.text: We live on our catamaran and anytime we go to land, we have to ride in our dinghy to get there. We often get splashed on the trip from boat the land and land to boat. These bags have kept purses, clothing, phones, computers, groceries, and more dry. We have a couple of each size and use at least 2 of them every single day. They are durable, show zero signs of wear even after months of daily use, and are truly waterproof! They also have backpack straps which make them perfect for hiking around water or in inclement weather. We really love them! In fact, we bought some as Christmas gifts for our boat neighbors!
customer_reviews.author: C. Mowry

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomended for any outdoor water use.
customer_reviews.text: I will use it today to walk a river and I have full confidence, that whatever I may put in it, it will keep it dry! It's quality is very good with it being such a high rating of pvc. I was also very surprised on how big it turned out to be so that was a good suprise! Over all a great product and I would defiantly recommend it to my friends and anyone who is looking for a product such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We were asked to provide our daughter needed a dry bag for a canoe trip and chose this one--glad we did. She is 11 and intentionally towed her gear overboard in this bag "to make room in the canoe". Everything stayed dry during a 4 hour trip one way down the Colorado River.
customer_reviews.author: CinTX

customer_reviews.title: In- love
customer_reviews.text: I use this for amusement parks. When I go out n about on a questionable summer day. When it’ll rain. My main use for it if for when I go out kayaking with it. I take this bad boy with me. Chuck it into the kayak with my vest attached. Keep everything I could possibly need in it. (Light jacket. Sunblock. Chapstick. Granola bars. Bottled water. Everything I could possibly need) Keeps it dry and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: IngridH

customer_reviews.title: The earth pak dry bag (10l) does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first, but they bag does what it says it does. I have used the bag (10 liters) on my day trips kayaking and all my gear stays dry even in heavy waves. However, I wasn’t too impressed by the construction of the bag. the seams on the bottom were frayed. I just took a lighter and melted them down. Overall you get what you pay for. My girlfriend opted to get one as well. I recommend this product to anyone looking for a bag to keep your goods dry weather it’s hiking or kayaking, but I wouldn’t submerge the bag. I haven’t tested to see how it holds up but that’s me.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great bag with a great style
customer_reviews.text: I like things that don't just function well but also look good, and this bag is beyond my expectation. I bought this bag for our honey moon to Hawaii, it looked great both on me and my husband. We loved this bag so much that we didn't just take it to the beach, we carried it everywhere, and not because we needed it, but because it made us look even cooler haha. And of course, it kept everything dry. 10L was a perfect size for us, big enough to fit all our necessities, and not too big or heavy to carry. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: T.W.

customer_reviews.title: All around great bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice dry bag, I'm really digging the material thickness and feel. I was planning my last snow machine trip of the season and my old dry bag had more duct tape than bag... I wanted to try something cheaper than my last name brand bag. So far, I'm impressed, had it strapped to the tunnel of my snowmachine for about 150 miles. Clothes, food and toiletries were dry, the bag is still in great shape(as expected), no rubs or holes or much more than dirty... I truly plan on purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: G.W.

customer_reviews.title: Love This Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Good size and durable for the active lifestyle. Great for the beach and camping. The phone pouch was a nice addition. It came packaged up really nicely. I plan to get other sizes and colors and makes a great gift. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cspitt40

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Freaking awesome for our paddle boarding adventures. I haven’t tried submerging it but I bet it would be just fine. Phone case works great and you don’t have to remove the phone from the case when taking pictures on the water. Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Kayaking in rough waters was a success!
customer_reviews.text: I took my wife kayaking for the first time on the Potomac River and what was supposed to be a beginners tour with a guide turned into rough waters and great teamwork; waters rough enough that we had some 12-18 inch white caps. Needless to say we took on a good amount of water and the bag was sitting in the front of the kayak between her legs. Once we were able to beach the kayak, our towels, gear, and food were all completely dry. The bag worked great and I would definitely recommend it to anyone that frequents the water and the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not cheaply made at all. This thing is gonna last I can tell.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really Really well made. I’m not a fan of the shoulder straps. I thought they were detachable but they are not. I Bought this to use for my sleeping bag and pillow but there is more than enough room I might even throw in a jacket and clothes not sure yet. Down side I can’t remove the shoulder straps. There really on there. It would probably create a leak if I took out all that stitching.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: very popular bag
customer_reviews.text: took this bag on a trip to North Carolina on a tubing trip and saw that the majority of the families there had one too! Great minds think alike. The bag was able to hold a towel, goggles, water bottle, sunscreen, etc...unfortunately my husband had his phone inside the waterproof cell phone bag and lost the bag with his phone in it at the bottom of the river. We ended up buying him a new phone. Other than that, the waterproof bag is definitely a smart buy if you like taking trips in the water to carry your things and keep them dry.
customer_reviews.author: Zoraida Haibi

customer_reviews.title: Great bag! Not fully rugged
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I took it on a kayak trip and was pleasantly surprised as to how much this holds and how well it did at keeping everything dry. I have had to update my review. The second time I used it the bag fell off of the kayak on the sidewalk and got a few holes in it causing it to no longer be waterpoof. I have yet to find a patch to fix the bag. Besides the bag not being extremely rugged as advertised I do like it for waterproof purposes.
customer_reviews.author: A_s11

customer_reviews.title: Full faith in the roll top, phone case is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolltop bag and it will get plenty of use on my kayak, the phone case is garbage I wouldn't trust it. The one that came with my order split open as I slid my iphone11 in. Not a big deal as it was a bonus anyway. Just check it out before you chance losing a phone in the river. Back to the bag. The 20L will comfortably hold my cannon rebel (in factory case/bag) With plenty of room for other items needing protection. A person could easily get a change of light clothing and some shoes in there with an overnight bag. Strap is solid, but will get a heavy teather for attaching to kayak.
customer_reviews.author: CDavid

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the pouring rain.
customer_reviews.text: When you have to go down to a remote location in Puerto Rico to work and you gotta keep stuff dry this is the product to have. Gear falling out of boat? No problem. Pouring rain? No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried to force it under water and really test it out yet, but I did take it paddle boarding and it worked great! I'm really happy with it. It's a good quality bag! It was a little hard to gauge the sizes of the different bags...may having pictures of people holding the different sizes or showing items, like towels, that can fit in the bags would be helpful to have in the product listing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bag is great! I bought two of the 10L size
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! I bought two of the 10L size. We took them snorkeling and kayaking while we were on a cruise. They never got in the water, but when I went to get off of the sail boat we were diving on I discovered they were drenched in spilled champagne. Sticky on the outside, but dry on the inside. I just wiped it off and kept on cruising.
customer_reviews.author: wendi@stargate.net

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I got
customer_reviews.text: Was looking at backpacks when I came across this bag and decided it was about right and fit my budget. The first time I used it, I was hit with some really bad July weather while hiking in MN. I don’t know about kayaking or throwing the bag in the water, but it sure kept my stuff completely dry through a few, successive storms — tornadoes included. I sometimes feel like an idiot for buying junk I don’t need; this is not one of those times.
customer_reviews.author: billyshake

customer_reviews.title: This bag is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This bag was amazing. My husband always carries a backpack on vacation so I don't have to carry a purse. We did a lot of beach days and hiking. It worked great for every occasion. I wish there were organizer pockets included. Because it isone huge bag so I recommend grabbing a few things to put stuff in so it saves time looking but it is very comfortable wearing for sure. I hope they come out with one.
customer_reviews.author: whodat nation

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this dry bag. I've not tested it for total submersion, but it surely keeps my stuff dry for the splashing I do while kayaking. I ordered two sizes--the 10 and the 20. I was glad I did that. We often pack a small lunch on our trips, so I needed the 20 to hold food and drinks. They look big, but by the time you fold them down, the size is much less.
customer_reviews.author: PamAnn

customer_reviews.title: Really really love them. I may even use them more than ...
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my mommies to go with their new kayaks. Really really love them. I may even use them more than they do. I've never had any problems with leaks. And the phone bag that comes with it is phenomenal. You can still talk on and use your phone while it's in the case. Pros - Never any leaks - Compact - Great material - Phenomenal phone bag - Good capacity (even though compact) Cons I didn't get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. Overall, very satisfied! I used this on a trip to the Philippines and used it frequently in the water. I took one star off the water resistance because I noticed dampness in my bag towards the end of my trip. Maybe it was user error? But I thought I was being pretty careful. Not sure if the water resistance wears over time, but it’s something I’ll be checking for the next time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack. Keeps water and moisture out
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this backpack to quite a few trips already and protected the contents really well and if you close it properly water or humidity will stay out. From the durability point of view it seems that will last for long after intensive use in the past 18 months. It has some marks as I bought the white color but doesn't show any crack or hole that could lead to a leak.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Troop Canoe Trip
customer_reviews.text: Our Troop was going on a winter canoe/camping trip. Aside from the fact these bags don't float when full, these bags provide a GREAT waterproof barrier to keep all your belongings! If you are wondering what capacity to get, I would suggest just slightly larger bag than whatever backpack you would load for the same length trip. This is to account for rolling down/securing the top of the bag. This purchase was well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: D. Willis

customer_reviews.title: protects my electronics
customer_reviews.text: Overall the bag worked great. As advertised it holds plenty and keeps everything nice and dry. Only issue i had is the latch for the shoulder strap, it only takes a little bit of pressure to pop out. It's not broken, just not as tight as i would like. I secured it with a ziptie, not ideal but i wanted to be able to carry it over the shoulder. the cell phone holder works great too. so far we've taken them on two river/lake trips.
customer_reviews.author: pellsx5

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you’re going on a water trip!!
customer_reviews.text: We went kayaking, catamaran boating, surfing, and lots of beach days on a recent Hawaii trip and this bag was ESSENTIAL. The catamaran company and the kayak tour company both gave these bags out for people to borrow so it was so nice to have our own instead. Surfers, kayakers and captains on the catamaran all used these bags. Also nice to keep sand out. Great to not have to worry about phones/iPads/magazines getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Emily H.

product_meta.title: Earth Pak -Waterproof Dry Bag - Roll Top Dry Compression Sack Keeps Gear Dry for Kayaking, Beach, Rafting, Boating, Hiking, Camping and Fishing with Waterproof Phone Case
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Package Dimensions :16.1 x 4.9 x 1.75 inches; 14.4 Ounces
 * Item model number :58mf-6nf5-BluePhone
 * Department :Womens
 * Date First Available :June 13, 2016
 * Manufacturer :Earth Pak
 * ASIN :B01GZCUDC6

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #234 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #1 inKayak Accessories 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.8 out of 5 stars7,899 ratings
feature_bullets: RELIABLE PROTECTION: We believe our earth pak dry bags are the best out there--bar none. These dry bags are meant to last for years and provide waterproof protection for even the most rugged users.

SHOULDER STRAP: 10L & 20L dry bags come with a 24-42 Inch single shoulder strap. 30L, 40L, and 55L waterproof backpacks are equipped with backpack style shoulder straps that also come with a sternum strap for added stability. Our new 55L also comes equipped with a heavy duty waist-belt, which relieves added pressure and helps support your load.

IPX8 CERTIFIED WATERPROOF PHONE CASE: We have included our IPX8 Certified 6.5 Inch waterproof phone case that will fit even the largest of phones. This case features a very simple snap and lock access that has dual-sided clear windows that allow to take pictures while still inside the case. Suitable for phones up to 6.5 Inches of diagonal screen size.
IDEAL FOR TRAVEL: Our water bag is very lightweight and compact making it an essential dry bag for all your travel plans. Easy to fold and pack tight in any sized luggage!

KEEP YOUR ITEMS DRY AND PROTECTED: Protect Your Valuables with our 10L, 20L, 30L, 40L, or 55L Dry Bags! Just toss your gear inside your water bag, roll it down, and you’re good to go on your next adventure.
